Bernadette Fong.writeup:
Hi! I'm Bernadette and I completed my undergraduate in Mechanical Engineering with a Robotics specialisation and a minor in Life Sciences. I'm currently studying Financial Engineering at the Risk Management Institute.

I like learning and took as many interesting as courses I could handle, including convex optimisation, business law, and business econometrics. Beyond that, I've also completed the Associate Data Scientist in Python pathway on DataCamp and the Foundations in AI course by AISG.

My internship and final year project has let me explore some of the areas where Life Science and Engineering intersect, two of the things that have fascinated me for a long time.

Outside of academics, I love hiking and travelling, gymnastics/calisthenics, and rock climbing/bouldering. Some mountains I've summmitted include Scout Peak (5710m) in the Himalayas, Mytikas Peak of Mount Olympus (2918m), and Mount Rinjani in Lombok (3726m). 

However, my personal mountain to climb is finding in a career that gives me such a strong sense of purpose that I would want to continue in it even when I feel secure in my finances.

Ian Ng.writeup:
Hello! My name is Ian and I am a graduate student pursuing a MSc in Data Science. Previously, I majored in Computer Engineering for my undergraduate degree. I have enjoyed my time in E-Scholars very much and am thankful for the friends I have made along the way.

I am a strong believer in the pay-it-forward culture and will gladly offer my advice/mentorship to any junior regardless of major. Feel free to drop me a message if you require any help from me, and I will be more than happy to assist you in any way I can!

Ryan Sui.writeup: Hi everyone, I am Ryan Sui, a Y4 E-Scholar having completed my undergraduate studies in Materials Science in Engineering (MSE) and am currently enrolled in the Masters in Business Analytics (MSBA) programme in NUS. My academic interests involved attempting to apply data-driven analytical techniques to different areas of material science such as cheminformatics. Feel free to reach out and ask any questions you may have, academic or otherwise, regarding the programme and student life at NUS in general. See you guys around!
Ryan Sui.notable_achievements: Surviving e-scholars (barely; remains to be truly seen).

Alyxia Seah.writeup:
Hi! I'm Alyxia, and I'm a Year 3 student majoring in Biomedical Engineering and Mathematics. I'm passionate about using math and computation to solve problems in biochemistry and biology, and I intend to work in mathematical or scientific research after graduation. Some of my academic interests include applied math and computational biology, specifically protein folding!

In my free time, I love solving and creating all kinds of puzzles. I participate in puzzle hunts regularly and I'm also part of Solve@NUS, an NUS interest group for avid puzzlers. If you enjoy solving any kinds of mind-bending puzzles, like word puzzles, logic puzzles, and more, please join us!

Feel free to reach out to me if you'd like to chat about anything!
Alyxia Seah.notable_achievements:
- Biomedical Engineering Achievement Award (2023)
- Champions in League of Legends Inter-College Games (2023)

Claire Lam.writeup:
Hi! My name is Claire and I am a Year 3 undergraduate majoring in Biomedical Engineering, with a specialization in Biomedical Materials and a Minor in Public Health.
A personal motto that I try to live by is “Not to make a living for myself, but to make living better for others.” This is one of the reasons I chose to major in Engineering, specifically Biomedical Engineering, as I aspire to innovate to improve lives.
The e-scholar community has been so supportive, fun and uplifting and I'm incredibly thankful for the friendships I've forged here so far! I'm definitely looking forward to the future memories we'll make together! 😁
Claire Lam.notable_achievements:
- Vice Captain, ACSI Cross Country A’Division 20/21,
- Interaction Committee for Connecting MINDS (student-initiated project supporting the Movement for the Intellectually Disabled of Singapore) (2020),
- Events Director (Welfare), E-Scholars Student Committee AY22/23
Claire Lam.interests_hobbies:
- Outdoor activities like hiking/running/just walks
- Watching kdramas and animes
- I love finding new music and going karaoke!

Kenneth Goh.writeup:
Hello everyone! My name is Kenneth, a year 3 Biomedical Engineering student with a specialization in Tissue Engineering, and a Minor in Life Science.

When I am free, you will see me at RC4 Squash and Spikeball IG sessions normally or just random sports IG. 

Reach out to me if you have any questions, or would just like to have someone to talk to :D

Yu Fei Ng.writeup:
Hi! My name is Yu Fei and I'm an E-scholar majoring in Biomedical Engineering with a minor in Life Sciences. Despite not taking physics in A-levels, my keen passion in Biology and Design encouraged me to explore the field of Engineering.

In my past industry experience, I had the privilege of being involved in the design and processing of 3D prints using CAD software. I primarily worked with SLA technology (Formlabs, Asiga), with brief experience handling SLS and FDM prints as well. I was also fortunate enough to be offered a role as a Global Markets Intern, where I got to expose myself to the market dynamics while working on the trading floor.
 
In my free time, I enjoy gaming and taking naps. I especially enjoy playing sports or just being outdoors in general. Outside of E-scholars and RC4, I am also involved in Chinese Orchestra and Muay Thai CCAs.
 
I am constantly seeking for new opportunities to learn and gain new insights from others, or to share some experiences of my own. If you are considering pursuing Engineering without a Physics background, or have an interest in macrobiology/ enotomology, feel free to connect with me :-)
Yu Fei Ng.interests_hobbies:
Sports
Nature & Hiking
Looking at ants

Karishma Thirumaran.writeup:
Hi, I’m Karishma! I’m a Y3 undergraduate majoring in Computer Engineering. 

Currently, I am interested in innovation in software engineering, and exploring the diverse opportunities in the sector such as automation, app development and AI. I am also passionate about business and entrepreneurship, and was part of the Jan'24 NOC Munich batch. 

Other than watching bad hallmark christmas movies, my personal interests include playing the drums and english literature. Feel free to connect with me to discuss about anything from cs to seasonal movies!

Meng Han Yeo.writeup: Hi! I'm an undergraduate at the National University of Singapore (NUS) studying computer engineering under the Engineering Scholars (E-Scholars) Programme. I'm very passionate about entrepreneurship and developments in the field of technology and innovation - specifically the forefront of Robotics, Computer Vision and AI. At the moment, I'm deeply interested in manifesting the power of LLM via AI Agents and Retrieval-Augmented-Generation (RAG).

Yu Xuan Shan.writeup: Hi! I am Yu Xuan, I had a lot of fun during my NUS journey, going to winter school, exchange, overseas trips and more. I will be going to Silicon Valley for internship soon.

Jiaying Zhuo.writeup: Hi! I'm Zhuo Jiaying, a year 3 chemical engineering student. I took SUSEP in year 2 sem 2 and am doing a specialisation in process engineering! 🥳

Kelvyna Lee.writeup:
Loving. Responsible. Respectful. These are words that people use to describe me. My values are shaped by my Christian faith and by my close-knit family.

I am thankful that I have been awarded the NUS Engineering Scholarship. I have also been offered a conditional admission to the Duke-NUS NUS Engineering and Medicine Track programme. 

Currently, I play Lawn Bowls for Team Singapore. This is a sport which requires mental strength and focus to bowl consistently, and the ability to adjust quickly to different in-game scenarios. 

I also serve regularly in church through singing and serving on the Audio-Visual team. My passion for missions has led me to Cambodia to bring joy to the less privileged, and I look forward to serving God’s people wherever I am called to!

Ellia Tio.writeup: Hello! I’m Ellia and I’m a Year 3 Electrical Engineering student. I’m planning to finish an IOT specialization and a minor in Information Security.

Hsien Rong Tan.writeup:
Hi there! I’m Hsien Rong and I am a Year 3 Electrical Engineering undergraduate under the E-Scholars Programme :)

Engineering is my passion. During my pre-university days, my avid participation in robotics competitions and hackathons led me to discover my love for building and designing things. Today, as an electrical engineering undergraduate, I continue to pursue my passion in robotics and programming. I remain captivated by the endless possibilities of what I can create, and am always excited to see my own creations come to life. 

Outside of NUS, I've worked with microcontroller programming, IoT, computer vision, signal processing and antenna design during internships with DSO and DSTA. I've also dabbled in app and game programming (Android Studio, Unity Engine, Godot Engine) for my personal projects.

I am excited to be part of the E-Scholars Programme, and I look forward to continue making new friends and learning new things as I enter my final year as an undergrad!

Jia Xin Teo.writeup:
Hello! I'm Jia Xin, a Year 3 E-Scholar Undergraduate taking a Double Degree in Environmental Engineering and Economics. 

I am really passionate about learning new things, as it makes me realise that there is so much in the world that I can discover more about. Outside of academics, I have had many experiences, ranging from leadership positions, volunteering, to internships in different disciplines.

Through the experiences I have gone through and the skills that I have picked up, my greater goal is to contribute back to the community. In the future, I hope to join the Public Service, to improve the lives of people through the work that I do, and ensure that Singapore can grow sustainably with inclusivity in mind.

Feel free to connect with me to discuss anything ranging from current affairs, sustainability, economics, or anything out there!
Jia Xin Teo.notable_achievements:
Champions of Singapore Undergraduate Policy Conference 2024 
Merit Award in Engineering Innovation Challenge 2023
7th to 16th placing in NUS Built Environment Case Competition 2024

I am always looking to explore new opportunities and meet new people, so feel free to connect with me anytime! :p

Janelle Tang.writeup:
Hello! I am Janelle, a Year 1 student majoring in Biomedical Engineering under the Engineering Scholars Programme at NUS.

While I am particularly interested in the area of research and tissue engineering, I am open to exploring other areas of specialisation and I hope to find something that I will enjoy doing in the future. 

I am grateful for this opportunity and I hope that this experience will help me grow both academically and as a person!

Xin Yi Tan.writeup:
Hello, I am Xin Yi, an undergraduate student majoring in Biomedical Engineering.  I am particularly interested in the manufacturing and innovation of biomedical devices. This encourages me to specialize in biomedical materials. It fascinates me  how engineers can invent new machines to reduce patients' discomfort, or provide alternatives to invasive surgical methods. After graduation, I aspire to contribute to society through my work in engineering. As such, I am grateful for the many opportunities provided by the E-Scholar community and look forward to the next few years of my academic journey. 

Aside from my academics, I also find solace in reading. I love the feeling of being transported into starkly different situations and experiencing them from a new perspective. Often, you can find me hunched over and immersed in a book. I also enjoy spending time with my family and friends, whether it's cycling at East Coast Park or huddling together over a game of Mahjong.
Xin Yi Tan.notable_achievements:
Vice-President of AVA Club ]
Best Improvement Award in J1 Promotional Examination
Honour Roll for JC2 Common Test

Celeste Tan.writeup:
Hi! I'm Celeste Tan and I'm studying Computer Engineering under the E-Scholars (Engineering Scholars) Programme. I plan to take two specialisations and then go on to take my masters in NUS, but as of now am still undecided. I am also aiming to join Bumblebee in NUS.

I do prefer the software side of computer engineering slightly more than the electrical side, but I do appreciate a healthy mix of both best, as I find that it excites me and pushes me to keep learning the most. 

Feel free to contact me if you have any questions or just want to connect!

Jordan Tan.writeup:
Hi! My name is Jordan and I'm a Year 1 Computer Engineering student.

I hope to enhance my coding and design skills through projects, internships and overseas attachments. I'm interested to explore more about artificial intelligence, robotics and other programming languages. As someone with a keen interest in aviation, I am excited to see how I can apply what I have learnt to make air travel safer and more efficient.

I really enjoy travelling, learning about new places and cultures, and exploring different cuisines. But chicken rice will always have a special place in my heart!

Hi I am Ryan, a Y1 CEG student looking into studying a specialisation (haven't decided on one yet). However, I do know that I am passionate in both hardware and software and bridging the two together. 

Outside of NUS, I am interested in a multitude of activities so feel free to reach out to me for anything!

Sanjay Kumar.writeup: Hello! I am Sanjay, a Computer Engineering major. I am passionate about science and engineering and I love acquiring new knowledge. I also love music and play the guitar!

Teng Yi Heng.writeup:
Hi! I am Teng Yi, a Y1 Computer Engineering student under the E-Scholars Programme. I enjoy designing, fabricating, wiring and programming robots (and other electronics projects). 

I got my start with electronics building autonomous soccer robots for RoboCup Junior in 2019, and I've been eager to learn more about electronics design ever since. 

In NUS, I'm hoping to delve more into integrated circuit design, processor design and low-level firmware programming; the area where hardware and software intersect is where I believe I work best.

Outside of class, I maintain software libraries and design circuit boards and casings for my educational robotics product line EVN. Apart from that, I intend to join the Bumblebee CCA to continue honing my electrical engineering and system integration skills.

In my free time, I like playing Ultimate Frisbee and spending time with my cats (they're very cute).

Technical Lead (& Co-Creator) of EVN Alpha, a robot controller for education & competition
Best Technical Challenges (RCJ Soccer Open League, RoboCup 2021 Worldwide)

I am passionate about leveraging research and engineering to make a positive impact on society. My primary interests in engineering lie in networking and robotics. I hope to participate in a student exchange program somewhere in Europe to experience studying overseas and gain new perspectives. Feel free to connect with me to discuss anything!

I enjoy challenging myself even outside of academia, for instance deciding to engage in activities that seem daunting when I am travelling or simply because I was given the opportunity to do so.

Ashlee Chang.writeup: Hi! My name is Ashlee and I’m majoring in Electrical Engineering. I’m passionate about Robotics and participated in competitions like Robocup and WRO for since P6! I hope to learn more about robotics and electronics in NUS and look forward to my time here :D

I’m interested in electronic devices and have interest in consumer audio equipment such as headphones, in-ear monitors, dacs, etc. I’m also an avid enjoyer of Japanese music, anime and manga.

I’m glad and humbled to be part of the E-scholars programme and plan to make full use of my time here.

Hi! I'm Grace, an Electrical Engineering major at NUS CDE! In my 4 years at NUS, I'm excited to learn how to apply my theoretical knowledge to ideate solutions to real life problems, which I hope to achieve by taking the 2nd major in iDP. 

I look forward to making full use of the valuable opportunities in NUS to deepen my theoretical knowledge.

Feel free to contact me regarding any enquiries or project ideas!

Jit En Faith Yap.writeup: Hi, I’m Faith and I’m a Y1 student studying Electrical Engineering. I’m interested in learning more about electromagnetism and its applications. Fun fact I was considering a double major in Psychology (decided against). Looking forward to my time here at NUS!

Weilin Zheng.writeup: Hi I'm Weilin! A fun fact about me is that I prefer popsicles to ice cream cones🥹 and my pet peeve is the smell of smoking😬. I’m very interested in the bonding and welfare committee because I really want E-scholars to have more opportunities to bond with one another on a regular basis!! This builds a support system that E-scholars can rely on, especially since we are all majoring in engineering, and so we can relate with one another better and understand each other’s stress and concerns( for eg on a common engineering course). Being more familiar with one another also prevents E-scholars from feeling paiseh in seeking help from other E-scholars. 😂 Also, I understand that most E-scholars stay in RC4. For me, I stay in nusc but the friends I have made from the E-scholars orientation stay in RC4 so I’m really sad that there’s little opportunities for me to interact with them :(( Hence, I really want to join the welfare committee to help organise bonding events so that E-scholars can have many opportunities to bond with one another!! :))) Apart from this reason, I also want to be involved in preparing welfare packs so that I can help E-scholars feel less stressed and more encouraged during exam period. All in all, the first few friends I have made in NUS are from the community of E-scholars so I really feel strongly for giving back and contributing to the welfare of E-scholars. :))
Weilin Zheng.notable_achievements:
When I was in junior college, I was a subject representative in class. I helped to gather feedback from my classmates ( for example, did they find the mode of teaching by our teacher effective/ did they find the homework given by our teacher too easy) and shared them with my teacher. I also helped to organise a class gathering whereby my class and our teacher came together to catch up and have fun.:) 

While I was in my CCA- chinese orchestra (CO), I volunteered to be an orientation group leader during a musical exchange between my junior college’s CO and 2 other schools’ CO. I helped to organise ice breaker games to facilitate bonding among students from different schools in my group. At the end of the day, I was glad that the students in my group got to know one another better and had fun playing the games together. :D
Weilin Zheng.interests_hobbies: I enjoy spending time with my friends, catching up on each other’s lives and understanding their current thoughts. Sometimes, I enjoy folding origami (eg hearts) according to YouTube videos and giving them to people I know :))) because I enjoy making them happy! Other times, I enjoy swimming/ jogging in a park.
Weilin Zheng.linkedin_url: I have not created mine yet.😓 I will be creating one soon though!!
Weilin Zheng.github_url: I have not created mine yet.😓

Hong Yi Lin.writeup:
HHI! My name is Lin Hong Yi, and I am a Engineering Science student under the Engineering Scholars Programme. I am currently living in Residential College 4! I am a Tennis addict and train regularly =). I also have side hustles in other sports such as Floorball and Volleyball!!! Hit me up for a sesh anytime, I'm sure they'll be time.

Academically, I am also pursing a second major in iDP as I love problem solving and design! I hope to secure a Semestral SEP in the upcomming academic year as well as a year long NOC after! At the same time I'm also exploring opportunities in Robotics as well as med-tech.

Amberly Pock.writeup:
Hi! I'm Amberly, a Year 1 Environmental Engineering Student doing a second major in Sustainable Urban Development! I'm part of the Engineering Scholars Programme and live at Residential College 4. 

I chose environmental engineering as I'm passionate about sustainability and want to learn how to create or improve on solutions that make the world more sustainable and better to live in, and I'm particularly interested in the field of renewable energy. 

In my time at NUS, I hope to be able to go on Semester Exchange Programme to widen my perspectives and experience new cultures, and take up various internships to put what I've learnt to practical use, and embark on projects that can help the environment and those around me!

Hannah Hoo.writeup: Hello! My name is Hannah and I'm a Y1 Environmental Engineering student, with a second major in Sustainable Urban Development. I am currently staying at College of Alice and Peter Tan. Feel free to find me to chat about anything!

Kae Lim.writeup: I'm doing Mechanical Engineering but I also have interests in material science, chemistry and linguistics. I enjoy working with my hands, including woodcarving, building furniture and legos.

Laura Lee.writeup:
As an Engineering Scholar specializing in Mechanical Engineering with a focus on Energy and Sustainability, I am committed to addressing global challenges, particularly those related to climate change and environmental sustainability. I aspire to attain the skills and knowledge necessary to innovate and develop transformative solutions in the energy sector.

With a deep passion for mathematics, physics, and engineering, I am driven to apply my expertise to create sustainable technologies that contribute to a better future. My approach combines analytical rigor with a commitment to social responsibility, recognizing the importance of leveraging my opportunities to effect positive change.

I am dedicated to continuous learning and collaboration, believing that true innovation arises from the intersection of diverse ideas and perspectives. Through my work, I aim to contribute meaningfully to the development of sustainable solutions that will shape a resilient and equitable world for future generations.

Loh Ming Cheng.writeup: Hello! I am ming cheng, staying at tembusu college. I am studying mechanical engineering, hoping to do a second major in computer science too!
Loh Ming Cheng.interests_hobbies: Sports, Playing board games and Nature!

Mao Ruijie.writeup:
Hi! I'm Ruijie, mechanical engineering undergraduate in NUS. I am grateful to be part of the Engineering Scholars Programme and its community of passionate individuals.

I constantly seek to learn and gain a deeper understanding of the world around me, from the socio-political dynamics of society to the physics of the universe. At the moment, I aim to pursue computing in conjunction with engineering to better leverage the strengths of our digital systems as a tool to understand the physical world. Examples include computational fluid dynamics, finite element analysis, and computational astrophysics (and numerical relativity). 

I am also invested in a wide array of hobbies in my free time, such as photography, graphic design, video editing, and playing the piano. Though, I am completely self-taught in all these areas. 

If you have any questions about me, feel free to contact me!
Mao Ruijie.notable_achievements:
Student Leader of the Year 2021 (River Valley High School)
Chinese Calligraphy National Youth Competition Champion

Ser Gi Chloe Tan.writeup:
Hello I am chloe. I study mechanical engineering under the e scholars programme. I reside in RC4 and im from Noctua (best house!!!) 

My academic plan as of now is to specialise in energy and sustainability, and hopefully, to be able to complete a second major in economics. I hope to be able to go for a student exchange program (SEP) in Finland, to experience what it is like to live and study in the world’s happiest country! 

Apart from academics, i find joy in road cycling, and I hope to be able to cycle from Singapore to China one day. I also enjoy playing weiqi, as it allows me to meet many different people from all walks of lives.
Ser Gi Chloe Tan.notable_achievements:
2022-2023 Deans list. 
China ASEAN board and card games international invitational tournament 2019.

Wei En, Wayne Lim.writeup: I am someone who is not very ambitious, but wishes to complete his degree in 3 years as well as a Masters by the fourth year. Being someone who over-committed himself to leadership positions in JC and secondary school, I wish to use university to pace myself, and understand more about the field I am going into, rather than dive into student life planning and coordination. Apart from academics, I wish to participate in dance, badminton and volleyball on the RC level, inter-RC and inter-house level games as well as fly drone.
Wei En, Wayne Lim.notable_achievements:
1) EAGLES award (2021)
2) NPCC Long Service Award (2021)
3) 6th in Army Intelligence Officer Cadet Course (2022)
Wei En, Wayne Lim.interests_hobbies:
1) Playing sports
2) Dancing 
3) Listening to music

Xin Yue Luo.writeup: Hi, I'm Xin Yue. SCGS and RI alumnus. I go with the flow and idk what I'm doing half the time. You can't control what life throws at you most of the time so I don't worry about it too much.
Xin Yue Luo.notable_achievements:
- ESIS recipient (2022-2023)
- getting the E-scholars scholarship

Yu Wei, Ryan Lee.writeup: I'm Ryan, an aspiring engineer looking to make a difference in the things I do. I'm constantly broadening my horizons, learning and experiencing new things every day and finding opportunities to put my knowledge to the test. Although I work hard, I also take the time to engage in a wide range of hobbies, keeping my mind refreshed yet active.
Yu Wei, Ryan Lee.notable_achievements: Research paper on Feasibility of Superman Memory

Claire Ng.writeup:
Hello! My name is Claire and I’m a y1 industrial design student, but I’m also an artist who does illustration. I love designs that are not only practical but also fun, lively and bold! I hope to learn how to marry the functional and minimal aspects of industrial design with the expressive dynamics of illustration throughout my years in university. 

As a part of the first batch of D-scholars, I am determined to do my best, not only for myself but also to establish a good foundation for future D-scholars.
Claire Ng.notable_achievements: SYF 2022 Art Exhibition - certificate of recognition
Claire Ng.interests_hobbies:
Illustration and animation
Watching movies and shows 
Eating good food

Zi Shuen Leong.writeup: I'm Zi Shuen and I'm an Industrial Design student under the D-Scholars Programme! I'm looking forward to pursuing a specialization in service design, but I'm excited to try everything else too! Backed by my interest in human behaviour, I aspire to dabble in human-centred solutions.
